text:
I have installed the 2.2.3 version of the web server Apache, and the 5.1.6
version of PHP. When i start the web server, it print that it can't load the
php5apache2.dll module (that's placed into the right folder). There's a problem
with the loading of the PHP 5.1.6 module???

P.S.
Sorry if my english isn't perfect, but i'm an Italian boy!
creator: nic@marzana.it
chris.relyea@gmail.com
text:
Same problem as below, also using PHP 5.1.6. Between Apache 2.0.59 and version
2.2.3, a problem has developed with the php5 module, specifically this line of code:

LoadModule php5_module f:/php5/php5apache2.dll

(F drive is my base letter drive)

Version 2.2.3 when installed and the line is commented out will start, when it
is not commented out, it will say it can not find php5apache2.dll.

Version 2.0.59 both starts with the line commented out and can successfully
find/load the module. 

The machine runs Win XP SP2, has no problems with 2.0.59 and can run
successfully with 2.2.3, unless I try to load the php module, which is there,
and which it can not locate/load

Are you using the same dll for 2.0.59 and 2.2.3? If yes, then it is quite clear
that this does not work. As 2.0.x and 2.2.x are binary incompatible you need a
php dll that has been compiled against 2.2.x.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
rpluem - I read this as you did...

"Between Apache 2.0.59 and version 2.2.3," 

there is no binary compatibility - you must obtain a module built
for apache 2.2.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
The bug is risolved with the download of the 5.2.0 version of PHP.
This release contain the file "php5apache2_2.dll" that's the PHP5 module for
Apache 2.
Thanks
creator: nic@marzana.it
